properties.areaDesc: St. Clair; Huron; Bay; Tuscola; Sanilac
properties.headline: Lakeshore Flood Warning issued January 10 at 1:33PM EST until January 12 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Significant lakeshore flooding expected.

* WHERE...Bay, Huron, Tuscola, Sanilac and St. Clair Counties.

* WHEN...From 7 AM Saturday to 10 AM EST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Numerous roads closed and low lying property including
homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be
inundated near the lake. Some shoreline erosion will occur.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Northeast winds will increase Saturday and
remain strong through Saturday night. This onshore flow will
lead to rising water levels and high waves, resulting in
significant shoreline flooding. Low lying areas along Saginaw
Bay will be particularly susceptible to flooding, as the river
level is forecast to peak near 80 inches above chart datum
Saturday evening at Essexville. Potential exists for flooding to
extend up the Saginaw River into Bay City.
properties.instruction:
If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be
closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of
unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone
property.

NWSheadline: LAKESHORE FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM SATURDAY TO 10 AM EST SUNDAY
